DataElement.preferredName: Patient Recurrent Disease Leukemic Blast Count Gene Expression CD19 Gene Gene Expression Outcome CD19 Gene
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._The determination of the number of leukemic blasts present in a sample._The return of a disease after a period of remission._Typically involves transcription of genetically encoded information into an intermediary message (messenger RNA) and subsequent translation into a functional protein._This gene plays a role in signal transduction and regulates the response of B cells to antigens._An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied._The result of an action._This gene is involved in mediating the adhesion between B cells and is a molecular marker for B-cell precursor acute lymphocytic leukemia._The process by which a gene gets turned on in a cell to make RNA and proteins. Gene expression may be measured by looking at the RNA, or the protein made from the RNA, or what the protein does in a cell._This gene plays a role in signal transduction and regulates the response of B cells to antigens.

PermissibleValues.value: Yes, partial expression on 20-90% of blasts

Gene expression on less than 20% of blasts
Gene expression on greater than 90% of blasts
